name: df-nmo
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cnmo, cmpo(s0, s1, cngp, cngp, cmpt(s2, co(cv(s0), cghm, cv(s1)), cinf(crab(s3, co(nat0, cico, cpnf), wral(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wbr(cfv(cfv(cnm, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4))), cle, co(cv(s3), cmul, cfv(cfv(cnm, cv(s0)), cv(s4)))))), cxr, clt))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ normOp =(s0 ∈ NrmGrp, s1 ∈ NrmGrp ↦(s2 ∈(s0[GrpHom]s1)↦ inf({ s3 ∈(0[[,)]+∞)| ∀(s4 ∈(Base ` s0),((norm ` s1)`(s2 ` s4))[≤](s3[×]((norm ` s0)` s4)))}, ℝ*, <)))
comment: Define the norm of an operator between two normed groups (usually vector spaces). This definition produces an operator norm function for each pair of groups ` <. s , t >. ` . Equivalent to the definition of linear operator norm in [AkhiezerGlazman] p. 39. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Oct-2015.) (Revised by AV, 25-Sep-2020.)
